title: Kerry Katona claims late ex-husband George Kay 'is better off dead'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Kerry Katona has opened up about the death of her ex-husband George Kay in her first television interview since his passing and believes he’s ‘better off where he is’.

George died four months ago from an overdose after a ‘fatal cocaine binge’ and the Atomic Kitten singer and mum-of-five told Janet Street-Porter, Gloria Hunniford, Stacey Solomon and Coleen Nolan that she is ‘angry’ that he choice substances over her and their family.

‘He didn’t kill himself, it was an accidental overdose,’ Kerry began in conversation with the Loose Women panel, ‘He was too vain to kill himself.

‘George had many issues, by the time I’d worked those issues out I was madly in love with him, we had a baby on the way.’

Talking about his death, she continued: ‘I’m just so angry, he gave me hell when he was alive and then he just left me, left this world, which I’m not going to lie, he’s better off where he is.

‘He was so unhappy on this earth. He had so many demons, so many issues.’

Kerry Katona got emotional during the interview (Picture: ITV)

Kerry’s youngest child Dylan Jorge, known as DJ, is the daughter she shared with George and she believed he’d turn his life around when she was born in 2014.

‘We thought when DJ was born, he’d change his ways,’ she said. ‘He had chance after chance, but he was never going to change.’

George Kay passed away from a drug overdose (Picture: Rex)

‘He was an addict and he chose drugs over you and the family,’ Janet Street-Porter said.

‘He did and I’m so angry, it makes you feel worthless,’ Kerry replied. ‘He did. It was the hardest decision.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Kerry and George split in October 2015 but decided to separate formally and divorce in November 2017.

She continued: ‘I left George because of what he was doing. I didn’t make him do anything that he didn’t want to do and I will not be blamed for his death.

‘I know if I’d stayed with George I’d be dead. I know it 100%. Or DJ would. I’m going to stand by that until the day I die. It was never going to happen [him change his life].’

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30pm on ITV.
